clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Multi-Denominational Prayer on Morbidity and Mortality of Patients Admitted to the Intensive Care Unite With Corona Virus Infection

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter; double blind randomized controlled study investigating the role of remote intercessory multi-denominational prayer on clinical outcomes in COVID-19 + patients in the intensive care unit. All patients enrolled will be randomized to use of prayer vs. no prayer in a 1:1 ratio. Each patient randomized to the prayer arm will receive a "universal" prayer offered by 5 religious denominations (Christianity, Hinduism, Islam, Judaism and Buddhism) in addition to standard of care. Whereas the patients randomized to the control arm will receive standard of care outlined by their medical teams. During ICU stay, patients will have serial assessment of multi-organ function and APACHE-II/SOFA scores serial evaluation performed on a daily basis until discharge. Data assessed include those listed below.

primary_outcome.measure: Impact of multi-denominational prayer on clinical outcomes of critically ill COVID-19 patients in the Intensive Care Unit on mortality.
primary_outcome.time_frame: daily until patient recovers and moves out of ICU or exits the study, up to 30 days
primary_outcome.description: This study will measure the difference in mortality of COVID-19 patients who are admitted to ICU - given prayer vs no prayer as an adjunct to standard therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in patient outcomes - Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Enquiry. APACHE II score.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily until patient recovers and moves out of ICU or exits the study, up to 30 days.
secondary_outcome.description: APACHE II uses 0-71 scale, the higher the score the higher the risk for mortality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in patient outcomes - Sequential Organ Failure Assessment - SOFA Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily until patient recovers and moves out of ICU or exits the study, up to 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: The higher the SOFA score the increased likelihood of organ failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in patient outcomes - Length of stay in ICU.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily until patient recovers and moves out of ICU or exits the study, up to 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: A prolonged length of time in ICU increases mortality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in patient outcomes - Length of ventilator support
secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily until patient recovers and moves out of ICU or exits the study, up to 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: A prolonged length of time with ventilator support increases mortality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in patient outcomes - length of vasopressor support
secondary_outcome.time_frame: daily until patient recovers and moves out of ICU or exits the study, up to 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: A prolonged length of time with vasopressor support increases recovery time.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive a daily prayer and standard of care treatment from multi-denominational group while in the ICU.
Patients will receive standard of care treatment while in the ICU.

intervention.description: receive prayers daily while in ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female greater than 18 years of age
- Confirmed positive for COVID-19
- Patient admitted to Intensive Care Unit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted to ICU for diagnosis that is not COVID-19 positive.
